sentences.english: We will find a way to create an orphanage for them.
sentences.chinese: 我們會尋找方法爲他們建立一所孤兒院。

sentences.english: As a result, the parents challenged the family to start an orphanage together in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 因此，家長質疑的家庭開始在墨西哥一家孤兒院一起。

sentences.english: Those in the orphanages needs cheerfulness.
sentences.chinese: 那些孤兒院需要歡呼聲。

sentences.english: Now, he spends his days practising Chinese calligraphy, writing and teaching piano at a local orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 如今，他每天練習中國書法，並在當地孤兒院教鋼琴。

sentences.english: This childless couple adopted a daughter from the orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 這對無子女夫婦從孤兒院認養了一個女兒。

sentences.english: Many children in the orphanage were starved often.
sentences.chinese: 孤兒院中的孩子們常常捱餓。

sentences.english: Ning Chang acted as a orphan from orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 張鈞甯在片中飾演來自孤兒院的孤兒。

sentences.english: Each year about 80 children are adopted by foreign families from the Huazhou Orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 每年化州孤兒院裏有80位孤兒被外國人領養。

sentences.english: With the capital he had saved, he converted the house into an orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 利用他積攢起來的資金，他把房子改造成一所孤兒院。

sentences.english: Excitedly, the boy went back to the orphanage holding the stone in both hands and reported all this to the dean.
sentences.chinese: 男孩興匆匆地捧着石頭到孤兒院，將這一切秉報院長。

sentences.english: They turned them over to state-run orphanages.
sentences.chinese: 她們只好把這些孩子送到國立孤兒院去。

sentences.english: After being rebuilt, the orphanage was set on fire a second time that same year.
sentences.chinese: 孤兒院重建之後，又在同一年再次被蓄意縱火。

sentences.english: We are also working in some of Beijing's orphanages and schools for the mentally handicapped.
sentences.chinese: 我們還在北京的一些孤兒院和培智學校開展工作。

sentences.english: The children were taken good care of in the the orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在孤兒院受到了良好的照顧。

sentences.english: She was taken to an orphanage in New Hebrides .
sentences.chinese: 後來她被送到新赫布里的孤兒院。

sentences.english: It was in the centre of Kampala.
sentences.chinese: 這個孤兒院位於坎帕拉的中心。

definition: to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
unable to go to school/an interruption to one's education
